title: Create gate system user guide
description:
Write comprehensive gate system documentation across the Diátaxis framework.

## Documentation Strategy

Instead of creating a single gate-user-guide.md, enhance existing Diátaxis structure for better organization and discoverability.

## Content Distribution

### 1. docs/how-to/custom-gates.md (Primary Work)
Currently has: Troubleshooting section only

**Add:**
- Create Your First Gate (step-by-step with examples)
- Manual vs Automated Gates (when to use each)
- Write Gate Checker Scripts (best practices, exit codes, working directory)
- Prechecks vs Postchecks (stage selection strategy)
- Gate Presets and Templates (reusable configurations)
- Common Workflows (TDD enforcement, CI/CD integration, code review)

### 2. docs/concepts/core-model.md - Gates Section
Currently: Placeholder comment

**Add:**
- What gates are and why they exist
- Quality checkpoint mental model
- Prechecks vs postchecks (conceptual difference)
- Gate bypass behavior for terminal states
- Gate status tracking and auto-transitions
- Relationship to state machine

### 3. docs/reference/cli-commands.md - Gate Commands Section
Currently: Placeholder comment

**Add:**
- `jit gate define` - Define new gate in registry
- `jit gate add/remove` - Add/remove gate requirements from issues
- `jit gate pass/fail` - Mark gate status
- `jit gate check/check-all` - Run automated checkers
- `jit gate list/show` - View gate definitions
- Complete syntax, options, exit codes for each

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] docs/how-to/custom-gates.md complete with all sections
- [ ] docs/concepts/core-model.md Gates section filled
- [ ] docs/reference/cli-commands.md Gate Commands section complete
- [ ] All code examples tested and working
- [ ] Cross-references between sections accurate
- [ ] Consistent with existing documentation style

## Benefits

- Maintains Diátaxis structure integrity
- No content duplication
- Each piece of information in canonical place
- Easier navigation (consistent framework)
- Follows existing documentation patterns
